results.title: Marey
results.brief_description:
In 1862, Etienne-Jules Marey, a French physiologist, with an interest in movement, devised a camera with magazine plates that recorded a series of photographs. Once combined, the pictures would represent movement, and in particluar, the flight of birds. Marey’s invention is regarded as a forerunner of the modermn motion picture camera. See also: ‘Pioneers of Photography’ (Ep.07): ‘The Fleeting Image’ (Available on VHS and 16mm).

Credits: No credits available.

results.title: Chaval
results.brief_description:
A valedictory film to the French humorist and cartoon cine-montage maker Chaval, little-known outside of France but revered in his homeland. Includes extracts from his films ‘Metamorphosis’, ‘Dessin’ and ‘The Good Book’. Chaval committed suicide in 1968.

Credits: Producer, Anatole Dauman ; director, Mario Ruspoli ; writer (narration), Georges Wolinski.
Cast: Pascal Mazzotti.

results.title: Abel Gance: Hier et Demain
results.brief_description:
In this documentary narrated by Abel Gance and directed by his former assistant (and filmmaker) Nelly Kaplan, the great director reminisces about his career which started in the silent era. With ‘Mater Dolorosa’ (1917) and especially ‘La dixieme symphonie’(1918), ‘J’accuse’ (1919) and ‘La roue’ (1921-23), Gance became a leading member of the French avant-garde. His work was characterised by dramatic excess (La dixieme symphonie), formal inventiveness (La roue), and technical innovation (split screens, complex camera movements, experiments with sound), all trends which find their apotheosis in ‘Napoleon vu par Abel Gance’ (1927), a five hour epic comparable to Griffith’s ‘The birth of a nation’ (1915) in its combination of reactionary ideology and formal brilliance.” Reference: Ginette Vincendeau. The companion to French cinema. BFI Publishing, 1996.

Credits: Director, Nelly Kaplan ; music, Michel Magne.

results.title: Montagnes Magiques = Magic Mountains
results.brief_description:
In this film montage Robert Enrico describes the enduring fascination of men for the mountains as well as the many relationship humanity has entertained with rock formations: from rock painting to health spa; from heretic stronghold (Montsegur) to Catholic pilgrimage (Lourdes) as well as the many research and scientific usages (observatories, solar stations).

Credits: Producer, J. Jacoupy ; director, Robert Enrico ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Francois de Roubaix.

results.title: Aurelia Steiner
results.brief_description:
Variations on the theme of love messages: the author reads a love letter written by a Jewish girl living in Melbourne while travelling along the Seine.

Credits: Producer, Henry Chapier ; director, Marguerite Duras ; writer, Marguerite Duras ; photography, Eric Dumage, Pierre Lhomme.

results.title: Zaa le Petit Chameau
results.brief_description:
Ali has new friend, a white camel called Zaa. But Zaa is kidnapped and taken to the market in Monastia (Algeria) to be sold. Narrated by Francois Perier.

Credits: Director, Jacques Poitrenaud ; writer, Claude Roy ; photography, Andre Dumaitre ; music, Guy Bernard.
Cast: No cast information available.

results.title: Django Reindhardt
results.brief_description:
This short film about Jazz legend Django Reinhardt is introduced by a text by Jean Cocteau. Commentary by Chris Marker, narrated by Yves Montand. Other musicians featured include Stephane Grapelli, Hubert Rostain, Andre Ekyan, Henri Crolla, Babyk Reinhardt.

Credits: Producer, Madeleine Casanova-Rodriguez ; director, writer, Paul Paviot ; photography, Jean Le Herissey ; music, Django Reinhardt.
